content: and knit the leg of the sock until the piece measures 7 3/4 inches long when i switch to stockinette i make the two smaller needles even with their number of stitches so i have 36 stitches on needle 1 18 stitches on needle 2 and 18 stitches on needle 3 it s also worth noting that if you want the cuff or the leg to be longer or shorter that s a fairly easy modification just be careful that if you make the leg too long it may be tight around the calf otherwise feel free to knit the leg shorter or do the whole thing in rib or whatever makes you happy heel instructions are for a french heel from the sock knitter s handbook p 55 this sock works the heel flap in heel stitch with a garter edge the heel flap is worked on half of the stitches of the sock begin with the ws facing you to get to this point i worked across needle 1 the needle with half my stitches and then turned the work so the ws was facing me i also like to put point protectors on the two other needles as i work the heel flap this isn t necessary but it makes me feel more comfortable as i know the stitches won t slide off of my needles work the heel flap back and forth for 36 row as follows row 1 ws k3 purl to end row 2 rs p3 *sl 1 k1 repeat from * to last 3 sts k3 i like to use a row counter to make sure i have done the correct number of row as the heel stitch is a bit harder to count than the stockinette also do not slip stitches at the beginning or end of the row picking up from the garter edge is actually easier than picking up from a slip- stitch edge and it doesn t leave as much of a ridge on the inside of the sock once you have worked 36 row begin the heel turn row 1 sl 1 p18 p2tog p1 turn row 2 sl 1 k3 ssk k1 turn note that there will be a small gap in your row of stitches between the working sts that form the heel turn and the unworked heel sts row 3 sl 1 purl until stitch right before gap p2tog p1 turn row 4 sl 1 knit to stitch right before gap k2tog k1 turn the easiest way for me to remember is by remembering that i want to do my decreases using the stitches on either side of the gap to close up that gap repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches of the heel have been worked you
